Reviews.Title: “Nice but time for a facelift”
Reviews.Author: SamGibbs
Reviews.Content: Whilst i enjoyed my stay at the Orchard there was no doubt that elements of the hotels presentation are in need of upgrading. On the whole aspects of the decor and furnishing are showing age and a well worn look. The room was spacious and comfortable and all the amenities worked. The staff also were friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet was very reasonable and offered plenty of variety and flavour. The coffee however tasted like dishwater....make sure you order fresh coffee. All in all i would say that the Orchard is a convenient hotel given its locality in Singapore but does not compete if you are looking for a more discerning upmarket experience in accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ready for a total redo”
Reviews.Author: Ch B
Reviews.Content: This hotel just outside of town and everything is ready for a total redo. After maybe 30 years of no refurbishment it is time to have the hotel redone. The rooms are noisy, too many groups and unwanted guests stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to be”
Reviews.Author: karnisingh80
Reviews.Content: First ad foremost we waited exactly for two hours to check in our room which was really unhospitable after 10 hours of flying. The rooms ofcouse were equipped with all ammenities but was really small especially the bathroom. We enjoyed the breakfast and the food which gave us a good value for money. We also appreciate the ambience but were a little uhappy with the unfriendly attitude of front desk managing staff

Reviews.Title: “Memorabable stay”
Reviews.Author: umesh_12
Reviews.Content: 1. Heart of city. 2. You can walk & enjoy the light of Orchid street. 3. Fantastic hotel. 4. FOr veg limited option of food in hotel. 5. A very good ambience. 6. ENjoy Chrismus, Deepawali, New year.........perfect place. 7. Very good hospitality 8. A very supportive staff

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jess W
Reviews.Content: Quite peacefull place to stay.very comfortable stay.very good service and hospitality.actually this was the most relaxing place for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ~ Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean comfortable modern room. Great hot and cold buffet breakfast. Short walk to convenience store(s) at nearby service stations. Bus stop at hotel. Short taxi ride to Orchard Road. October 2007 one night stay before midday Europe flight. Recommend it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for your stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Surjya
Reviews.Content: We were on a family vacation and the agent had booked our stay in singapore in this Hotel. The hotel is excellent with all modern facilities and even has its own Indian restuarant. Also service is excellent . Only problem is that it is located in one corner of the city in a residential area. There are no shopping places or site seeings nearby. You have to use a vehicle evrytime you want to go somewhere even if you want to buy a bottel of water. The nearest shopping malls are also a distance away. Evening if you are willing to take a walk nothing is nearby. Location is a big drawback for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ashish158
Reviews.Content: i think its d best hotel in singapore with good service and hospitality...its in d center of any place u want to visit for sight seeing etc etc in d hotel there is i beautiful swimming pool gym where u can relax i really liked d place

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiHappyFeet
Reviews.Content: Very good, cozy and spacious rooms with balcony, lot of space to move around.... nice view. Priced a little on the higher side though. It is not very close to the tourist attractions yet the travel is comfortable and easy. There is a shuttle to Orchard road, Indian street every half/one hour. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Copthorne Orchid Hotel - Singapore - excellent service & stay”
Reviews.Author: GautamVerma
Reviews.Content: My wife & I are extremely fond of travelling. We ensure we travel once every three to four months, just to rejuvenate ourselves. We visited Singapore a second time in February this year, just because the first time we visited it during our honeymoon, five years ago, we couldn't see or travel much due to the fact that both of us had taken ill out there; must say it was pure bad luck that time. Anyways, this time, in February, we took another trip to Singapore and stayed at the Copthrone Orchid Hotel; just because we wanted to see all that the city had to offer and visit. This hotel is 10-15 minutes away from Orchard Road, so it's relatively peaceful, and away from the hustle bustle of Orchard road. Being a business and leisure hotel, it has all amenities on offer; like conference facilities, wi-fi service, swimming, amongst a host of other activities. We had a swell time out here; the food is delectable and the staff is extremely courteous, just like one would expect in hotels. The hotel offers a free coach ride to Orchard Road every 30 mins, that too free of cost. This helps a great way when you want to save on the expensive cab fares. The hotel offers an excellent buffet lay-out, with Indian and Continental cuisine on offer. Being in Singapore, the hotel is one of the best, if you don't want to spend a lot of money. The rooms are extremely clean, with all modern amenities available in the rooms. One gets to enjoy a peaceful stay at this hotel, along with all activities for kids, and grown-ups to enjoy. Do stay at this hotel, when in Singapore; you sure would love the stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paulanant
Reviews.Content: Considering you want to have a comfortable stay in Singapore, this is a very comfortable place. Only that sometimes you can find your self bit in an isolation,however its quite peaceful and the rooms are cozy! Enough space to move around and good customer and room service. Price is good considering you take a weekend package. Only downside is no view from the hotel room. However worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: schaturvedi
Reviews.Content: Its an average hotel, rooms are not comfortable, in my understanding its a 2 star hotel, they have lot of room for improvement, perhaps the fact that, majority group tours are booked here, maybe they are not much bothered, i would say its an average hotel nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: SheetalKini
Reviews.Content: stayed here as part of our thailand-malaysia-singapore trip. the place is good value for money. its near the main sites of singapore but its still in seculded quite place. the breakfast buffet spread it offers is also decent

Reviews.Title: “Not worth”
Reviews.Author: anindyasen
Reviews.Content: Did stay here for one night with my family but checked out the next day as it was not as good as we thought it would be. Although we were staying in the Club category rooms, the rooms were pretty old & the bed was very small in size for me, my wife & my 5 year old daughter. The toilet was the smallest toilet I have ever used in any hotel anywhere & it did not have any exhaust fan. However the size of the room was very big. Being a club room, I was expecting would automatically qualify for club facilities but that was not so. The room did not have a free Wifi & I had to go with my laptop to the lobby to get free Wifi. I must admit that the rooms were very old & you could feel that they need an immediate changeover. The breakfast was good & the staff were courteous but because of the old & run down rooms, I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: ardeshir46
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located not far from downtown area and it is really a beautiful to stay in. It has very good service including all modern amenities .The rooms are well furnished though the lighting in the rooms I felt was inadequate . The food is great with a huge spread of things to eat. Service is excellent incluging the security of the room as you cannot access the lift until you punch on your hotel room card then only the lift will work. Overall it is a superb hotel to stay in with value for money though on the higher side.

Reviews.Title: “excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: ajay2670
Reviews.Content: excellent,hotel and room service,good food,,,,,,,,good connectivity to malayasia thr road,,,,golfing and party at ni....at ministry of sound...............shooping at orhard road''''''''''''''''''''''''''''

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay with little hostile behaviour!”
Reviews.Author: Pratik812
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent...a perfect luxurious place to spend your holiday with your loved ones. the hotel provides all basic facilities along with premium amenities which are obviously top class. Though the motto of every person at the hotel is to make you feel at home, we kinda faced with some hostile behaviour. Though our bookings were done way before, we were made to wait at the hotel for quite some time with our luggage on arrival. The receptionist was a dismal to our expectations. we were soon saved by another receptionist who kindly fast forwaded our request and allotted our rooms. The mood was soon forgotten as we excitedly got into the swimming pool. the restaurant was pretty expensive. it is located at the heart of the city and has an awesome view. cleanliness and room service was maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, Value for money....”
Reviews.Author: Govind_Yadav
Reviews.Content: Copthrone Orchid Date: December 1st week, 2010 The hotel was excellent deal given the price at which it was available. It had all possible amenities including Indian vegetarian restaurant. I and my wife being pure vegetarians really appreciated... Not to mention the good food.... We were there on our Honeymoon and the place was just fine for this... Our balcony faced the famous Raffle’s town hall which had a magnificent view. The hotel is situated on the main road very close to bus stop. The hotel had excellent shuttle service to Orchid road every half hour. We utilized this service twice every day.... Last but not the least, the staff was very courteous and offered us to check in a couple of hours before our scheduled check-in time...

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok ..only recomendded if there is no option”
Reviews.Author: Derajb
Reviews.Content: hotel is well located the checkin was slow and staff wasnt very friendly and helpful breakfast was ordinary to say the least the good thing was they had a coach service to drop at orchard road and mustafa centre the indian restuarant is nice though and since the hotel is a lil off from the busy street the night sleep is peaceful

Reviews.Title: “decent & safe to stay”
Reviews.Author: SKPMUM
Reviews.Content: It was good n comfortable stay, breakfast was good .away from Orchard road by 1.5 kms but with shuttle service facility it was easy even for shopping. The staff was helpful and professional in their service. Nice Ambience and a decent rooms for a good night sleep after a hectic business day in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: kkunal
Reviews.Content: This was one of our worst experiences what they show on their website is no where close to what is delivered Even after a confirmation of an early check in me and my pregnant wife were asked to either go somewhere and come back in 4-5 hours or sleep in the lobby till they clean rooms very noisy place with large tourist groups staying very badly maintained rooms and toilets very uncorteous staff at the breakfast place in the mornings taxi is easily avaialble outside the hotel Overall i would never wanna stay here again nor would i want to reccomend it to anyone on holiday but if for business is fine its too noisy and also the quality of room for the price is not worth it at all we can get far better quality rooms at the same price

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Rooms are clean but pretty old.”
Reviews.Author: jelly_man16
Reviews.Content: When we first went in the hotel it looked really nice. The lobby was really nice. The rooms however were just okay. We got the connecting room since 4 of us could not fit in just one room. The room was clean but it looked pretty old. Our safe didn't work but a man gladly fixed it for us. The location was okay but you have to take a cab or the hotel's FREE shuttle to go somewhere (you cannot walk anywhere from the hotel). Singapore is full of nice places so we weren't in the hotel much. We were just in the hotel to sleep, take a shower and dress up. We did everything else outside. Overall the hotel is average, we had no problems (except the safe but someone fixed in a few minutes), the room was clean and we slept well.

Reviews.Title: “An above average hotel - can stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Varun_Mutreja
Reviews.Content: I would rate it as an above-average hotel....the rooms were tidy and service was okay. it does have an in-house restaurant and the food is okay. Though nothing to complain about the hotel, but still it was not really the one which fascinated me enough!

Reviews.Title: “Smells like mold, the lobby is the most beautiful part”
Reviews.Author: sdsurfkitty
Reviews.Content: It was a good thing there was a lot to see in Singapore and we were hardly in our rooms because they were less than fantastic. The smelled of mold and were run down. The hotel lobby is a whole different world, it is beautiful and clean and smells wonderful. The Copthorne Orchid Hotel is about a 10 minute drive to Orchard Road. They do offer a convenient shuttle service but I think next time we will definitely stay on Orchard Road for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but unexciting”
Reviews.Author: CMTWoking
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable, breakfast adequate. The toilet didn't flush properly, but reception sent a maintenance man promptly to try to fix it. The hotel is some distance from Orchard Road and the city centre, though they have a shuttle bus and the public bus stops nearby. Singapore is an expensive city and you get what you pay for - this hotel is OK if you are on a budget but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “I have been here and it was nice experience near to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Kaprocks49
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in thsi hotel and this one is queit and tidy. Its neat and no much fuss about it. Staff is also co-operative . You get taxis but sometimes u can get delayed. It has spacious rooms. Its near to Orchard Road and you have free shuttle for hotel guests to Orchard Road and Mustafa centre.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Dirty & Rundown Hotel Should have a Government Health Warning!”
Reviews.Author: raffles22
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms in appalling condition, battered dirty furniture. Black mould in bathroom, no handle on wardrobe door & doors off runners. Swimming pool unusable, tiles missing big concrete patches on bottom of pool, black mould and green algae and leaves all round pool. Several big black cockroaches running round. Bell boy said place was a no star hotel and the reason it was dirty was because they were busy and did not have enough time to clean! Hotel is quite a way from city centre and hotel shuttle bus only runs once an hour and only seats 24 people so we had to use lots of taxis. Apparently hotel is being closed in the near future according to hotel staff and taxis drivers because it is too old and too far from city centre. There was a sales and marketing of about ten people in the hotel the whole seven (nightmare) days we were there advertising Glyndebourne Luxury Freehold Homes with a show appartment on sixth floor of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there”
Reviews.Author: whitehead21
Reviews.Content: if you are planning to go there in the next few months I suggest you start looking for another hotel NOW,we stayed there 1/11/ 10 to 8/11/10 this hotel is dirty and the staff dont care if you are there or not,The 1st room they took us to was dirty ,needed painting (so many marks on walls)and needed a very big up date,the bellboy rang and asked if the room was ok before he brought our luggage to the room why would he do that!!!!!!!!!! in fact the best thing to say about this hotel was to close it down.ohh yes I need to tell you ,it will be closing down in jan/feb 2011 to be made into luxury flats ( that is all you see when you enter the hotel) Lets get to the swimming pool now, or rather not, because you could not imagine how unclean it is.I could go on and on and on,but just want to tell you dont go to the copthorne orchid .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is closing soon to make way for a luxurious condominium”
Reviews.Author: edupod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is going cheap now as it will be closing soon. The hotel will be torn down and in its place will be a luxurious condominium named Glyndebourne. The management slated this hotel for redevelopment some years ago and stopped all upgrading and service improvement initiatives. The staff will be transferred or laid-off. Say goodbye to them

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GurgaonRajesh
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel but little bit out of city . very comfortable . breakfast was goodand shuttle service was good

Reviews.Title: “bathroom -disaster!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DenzelBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms in our room and our daughters were AWFUL!!! mould around the edges of the bath, in the cracks of the tiles. Water coming out of the shower which was over the bath and going onto the floor even though the shower curtain was fully pulled to the end of the bath. Also the tap in the wash basin was dirty and looked like it hadn't been cleaned. Stayed the same for our three days visit. We booked interconnecting rooms-our daughter and two grandchildren were with us. We were told at booking that we would have this but NO we were told when we arrived that they don't have interconnecting rooms any more so our daughter and the two small children were on the other side of the floor and about 4 rooms away. Not happy!!! We don't consider ourselves as being people that are hard to please but there is no way I would ever stay in this hotel ever again and I have reported this to our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Andalusianeyes
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with excellent service and courteous staff. The rooms are spotless and very comfortable. Facilities for conferneces and meetings are excellent. The hotel serves a lavish breakfast. They run two shuttle services to upscale Orchard street and Little India every evening around 6 pm. The hotel is excellent except for its location. It is not close to MRT and you need to use either a taxi or a public bus to go anywhere, which is slightly inconvenient. To get to the hotel from the airport you can take a shuttle which would drop you at the doorstep of the hotel. It is a. good 40-45 minute drive from the airport. The hotel is located in a very beautiful upscale neighborhood which is good to explore onfoot but there is no other attraction nearby for people wishing to spend their evening pleasurably. I was there for a conference and after the conference all participants used teh hotel shuttle to go to with Orchard Road or Al-Mustafa in Little India for shopping. I one missed the last returning shuttle at 11 pm since it arrived 15 mins early and the I had to take a public bus which was inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “""Very Bad"" Front Desk Staffs...”
Reviews.Author: whiteky
Reviews.Content: Bad service from front desk...My first time staying at this hotel....which i been recommented by my singaporen friend! This is very very bad front desk staffs... i staying 2 nights with my friend, upon check in around 2200hrs the staff not welcome me at all. They busy doing they stuff and ignore me almost 5mins..i standing infront for the lady short hair chinese girl (only she having short hair like china doll hair style) i forget the name...please ignore her when you check in to this hotel...! After 5 mins she still ignore me until my friend scold her, she only check me in but she ask her friend a guy which no smile at all. The room was poor and the pool was dirty. location bad just have shutter bus. I call to operator ask question they only know answer me "i don't know"..what answer is that? Upon check out the lady from the desk also ignore me again keep busy with her stuff(i think she is supervisor) she did't give me any invoice until i ask for it! Pls do some training for your stuff, and they treat different skin color different attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: diego1960
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 2 nights on our way to Siem Reap. Hotel is good bit out from town and by a busy duel carrage way. Even the nearest MRT is a taxi ride away but at least the taxi service is frequewnt and cheap. The hotel itself is fine and fairly standard on first impressions. We were put into the Plymouth Suite and, well, the whole block had a very bad musty smell throughout. The carpets were stained and the place looks like it hasnt been decorated in 20 years. I can only guess that water pipes must have burst as I cant explain why there was such a bad overwhelming smell throughout. Our room was adequate. Poor natural light, noisey road outside and the bad musty smell was also present. Breakfast was non descript and again just about adequate. Room servive was good and the food was resonably good. Never used the pool or spa. Fine for 2 nights but dont have high expectations. Oh yes..the use of the internet was $11.77 SD for 30 mins which was an incredible rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Abhishekanand
Reviews.Content: Copthorne Orchid is a nice place to stay. It is a 3 start hotel located close to city center and Orchard road. They provide a free shuttle service to the city center and orchard road every hour. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and neat. It has a great dining hall, pool and other recreational facilities. Staff is friendly and helpful. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic service & very unfriendly staff....”
Reviews.Author: Inditrav
Reviews.Content: Service is pathetric and staff is very unfriendly..they dont bother about anybody and dont even attend to calls... Bell desk is almost worst which I have ever seen.. Front desk team in very arrogant

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, but hotel desperately needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: UKEscaper
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a week as it was the closest to the work site. Unfortunately some of the reviews are right, the corridors did smell of mildew and the hotel really needs renovating, or at least new carpets and a lick of paint. I would disagree with the comments regarding the staff, I could not find them any more helpful and represented the general impression of Singapore, very polite, pleasant place to be. I have concerns about the bar arrangements, either Topps (a lounge bar) that requires a cover charge to enter, or Limelight which is a Karoke bar, so each night it was in to get a beer and walk out before my hearing was permanently affected. On a positive note, Channel 16 was English Premiership Football 24/7, although watching the same games over and over again was tiring. HBO also available. Unfortunately due to heavy workload, only got out to see Orchard Road, so waiting for next trip to see more of the island, although I will be staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel to stay...”
Reviews.Author: hello02
Reviews.Content: Copthorne Orchid Hotel is a nice hotel with all the basic amenities provided by the hotel. the rooms are very clean with tidy bedsheets and neat bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Food Poisining”
Reviews.Author: Squinch-Joint
Reviews.Content: 1) The room I was given was located in an adjacent wing. Soon as I exited the elevator I could smell mildew. My room had mildew growing at the bathroom door due to a shower leak. Funny thing is, they cut out the carpet and replaced it before. This was the "fix" instead of repairing the leak. ID10T's to say the least. 2) Breakfast was horrible. $21 USD for a buffet of slop even a Hog would toss up. After eating, I felt sick and eventually had to upchuck the spoiled food. Ruined my trip. 3) my room had no direct internet access and I had to rent a dongle. I needed to pay S$400 deposit and also S$30 for the internet. The speed was equal to 1986 Dial-up. 4) No complimentary water at this place. Pay for everything. Even if the water is potable, a water bottle is convenient. 5) I was happy 2 times at this hotel... The moment the driver found the hotel and the moment I exited the dump. In closing, I recommend NOT to stay here. If you do have to stay at this shanty hotel, take your own noodles and drinks. DO NOT eat in the cafe. I give it 2 thumbs down and wish I had more hands to make it 4 thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic!”
Reviews.Author: AleeshaGupta
Reviews.Content: We had quite a tiring day after long bus journey from KL to Singapore at early hrs. We got our hotel bookings done through one of the trip agents. We checked in our room and what we find - untidy linens, NOT -flushed WC!, Coffee mugs with coffee dripped all over the table, dirty bathroom with all black soil spots everywhr! Iliterally wnted to ask who stayed here b4 we chked in. We had jam packed schedule for the day and had only 3 hrs to get sm rest and get ready to xplore S'pore. But to our surprise we were not the only guests to get such a dirty welcome but our fellow travelers also got untidy rooms. We informed the hotel reception about the same and ONE house keeping girl, who was too rude and responded with not so warm gestures, was sent for the full floor which had like 15 rooms. People were literally standing over her head to do their room first. I went to the reception and asked them if they could shift us to some other room. But they straight forwardly said " we are full". I told her bout the room condition and had to use toilet urgently for which she replied back " ma'am there are others too who want use the wash room. we have pregnant women waiting for rooms to get cleaned , you guys are young couple. Please bear with us." She looked like she was proud of this fact that she has made expecting mothers wait to relief themselves!. Disgusting is less a word for them. When we got our room cleaned and we 'actually' checked in, we saw that flush was not working, we had two single beds kept far apart with good wooden telephone table playing the game of not letting the beds come together at all, t.v. was not working and so was the controller for it. I never had such a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Raga_queen
Reviews.Content: Very good - well organized. Good restaurant. However away from city center but has a nice shuttle. I arrived at 6 am, but my room was ready for me. Good air conditioning - essential in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Questionable Standards? AVOID AT ALL "VALU"”
Reviews.Author: Ashz78
Reviews.Content: I had recommended this hotel to a family friend that had booked 5 rooms. Is been hugely embarassing for me as i still wonder of a hotel of such sub-standards can be operational in a sunny country like Singapore. There were issues with checking-in, to receiving a bell boy to help with the luggage (whom told my guests to wait and sit arounf the floor until he gets the time to take their bags!!!), room service (a total classic- after not receiving bottled mineral water for 20mins, a re-check with room service forced an answer such as"please do not push us as we have a standard procedure to follow!).. My guests and I had returned to the hotel arounf 11pm and we were having shopping bags (no surprise the bell boy was no where near.) When I had gone to call him, he walked to us and with such arrogant attitide flagged that we could not bring in marketing bags to the room!.... Well there is just more to be shared upon this - so I will be happy to share more insights when contacted personally.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the mark”
Reviews.Author: PuneBob
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not have the welcome feeling. The service is "too cold". Rooms are OK, not great. Maybe the hotel is popular because of its affordability. Overall, it was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “If I go to Singapore again I would stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S_S_JDelhi
Reviews.Content: We had a family holiday at Malaysia (Langkawi, Genting and Kualalumpur) and Singapore. From the Hotel point of view, our best stay was in Copthorne Orchid Singapore. The hotel is well located and has very quiet surroundings, still well connected through shuttle service, taxi, etc. to the main markets. Though we arrived early for check-in and had wait for a while for our rooms, the final stay was comfortable and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Wendy074
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say, but that this was the most disgusting hotel accomodation I have ever experienced ,from dirty walls, carpet ,bathroom & dining room, this is also apart from the very unhelpful staff!!!! If your travel agent ever books you into this hotel change as soon as possible. After a most wonderful trip to Vietnam this was a very disappointing way to finish a holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but unfriendly staff and not a great location”
Reviews.Author: pbs1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the room was good, clean and big enough to accommodate myself and my friend. The location wasn't the best in the world but the hotel does run its own shuttle service which goes to the DFS Galleria on Scotts Road and back throughout the day, and from there the nearest MRT (underground) station is ION Orchard which is 5 minutes away. Get the Singapore Tourist Pass which costs SD34 for 3 days (SD10 of it is a refundable deposit) which allows you unlimited access on the MRT and buses. Having said that about location though, it is situated in a scenic residential area and near the University and Botanical Gardens which is all nice for taking a walk around. The breakfast buffet was very good, the bacon was the best I've ever had! I wouldn't bother having dinner here, just take a 5 minute taxi ride from the hotel to Newton Circus where you can eat for much cheaper. However we found it very difficult to get a taxi back, there was no taxi rank, we couldn't hail one down as they drive too fast to slow down, if you try to phone a cab company you're put on hold for ten minutes, and the drivers in the yellow taxi even refused to take us to our specific hotel for reasons they did not give! Singapore taxi drivers are by far the most arrogant too. So what we did the second time round was to get the MRT from Newton station nearby to ION Orchard, from where we caught the hotel shuttle (last one at 10pm). A bit ridiculous though. The staff are useless when it comes to asking for tourist information and they didn't seem too friendly in general either. We only found out from the concierge how to best get to Little India when we asked him the best place for a dosa as he was Indian! You basically have to get the 66 or 67 bus from the bus stop outside the hotel for only SD1.60 and get off at Serangoon Road. Overall the stay was good and the room was very nice for the price we paid staying in such an expensive city as Singapore, the location isn't great if you want to do more things in the city centre such as going out. Didn't think much of the staff though.

Reviews.Title: “happy for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: jayne21p
Reviews.Content: we booked 3 nights, happy with room and breakfast, rooms were clean and decent size. Good breakfast of a mixture of things to pick from. The only thing i would say about this hotel not walking distance to the shops and main area, they do have a free shuttle bus though which we used a few times. And taxi's didnt cost much either when we did use them. The night time safari we thought was a waste of money, good for people with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Splendour- value for money”
Reviews.Author: AnnamalaiBangalore
Reviews.Content: It is good to stay ... Cheap and fine hotel to stay .. Only disadvantage is far away from city The Food was nice and there some people who knows Tamil Language and they are very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're staying in this part of town.”
Reviews.Author: gina_syd
Reviews.Content: I'm led to believe that the hotel is due to be demolished...and it shows. Much of the property is in disrepair including hallways, the swimming pool and the musty smelling bar. In fairness the rooms were clean and the beds OK, but if you're looking for something modern then this isn't for you. The staff were moderately helpful if not a bit aloof, and once again trying to be fair, they were rushed off their feet with the many stranded people (due to the volcano crisis). The location was OK, only around $10 to Orchard Road, but not right in the heart of things. As for value for money I would definitely shop around and try for something closer to the main part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: tankerman1
Reviews.Content: If you are stopping over in Singapore then this hotel is a decent place to do just that. I stayed 1 day & night, and was more than happy with this hotel. Had to wait a little long at reception when checking in, and the staff could have smiled a little more, but I am nit-picking. If you are in a room in the "far away" wing, then you will have to get a lift up to the first floor, then walk through some alleys and get another lift to your floor. This was very confusing, and not clearly signed. The room itself was very spacious, witha balcony overlooking the Raffles Club. The traffic was a little noisy, as the slide door was not fitting 100%, but after the flight from London heathrow, it was no problem to get to sleep. I probably would not choose this hotel for a long stay, but for a stop-over, it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay there i was there 3 nights and had 3 different rooms all had things wrong with them”
Reviews.Author: miffy4545
Reviews.Content: this hotel is old dirty and miles from anywhere . the first night i stayed my toilet did not work . i was then moved to another room where the water came through the light in the roof from the air conditioning it could of started a fire .and the last night i stayed there the window was fallling out of the wall . DO NOT STAY HERE if you want a relaxing holiday

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to relax”
Reviews.Author: may78bangalore
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay, comfortable and roomy, service is excellent. Staff is very helpful especially when you are travelling from other countries. Good tie ups with tour operators, which will make your trip memorable. A beautiful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: justchilling5
Reviews.Content: We went to visit Singapore visit in the summer vacation. Our booking was done by our travel organizer Cox and Kings at Copthorne Orchid Hotel Singapore. The hotel is small yet very warm and comfortable. It has a nice swimming pool and Gym area and a spa too. The lobby area is very nice

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel to stay at Singapore”
Reviews.Author: VIG001
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with swanky rooms and basic amenities for travel. Can be a good for a break at Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & service but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: AnkitBhutani
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not recommended to me by my travel agent and she was giving me cheap hotels in Little India region of Singapore..but I wanted to stay in 4 or 5 star property. I chose this based on friends recommendation. The hotel is located away from central happening location in Singapore but if you are looking for classy stay and want to relax then you can easily pick this. If you are of those kinds who want to shop near to your hotel then pick something in central location. Room was deluxe and very pretty.. neat and stylish. Swimming pool was nice and gym was very good. Forgot to mention the atrium..its one of the most attractive atrium I've seen. We took nice late night walks around the hotel which was very quite and peaceful. Rates were on little higher side ...around Rs 6000 per night but hotel is flawless in their delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandsmouse
Reviews.Content: Nice middle of the road hotel - not sure about the 4 star rating but exellent location and staff were very helpful . Room small but very comfy . Good choice on breakfast menu

Reviews.Title: “Stop Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marge079
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on our way to New Zealand and one night on our way back. Room only. Bed linen looked clean and crisp which was the main thing as it was mainly intended as a stop over to break the long journey with a sleep to re-charge our batteries. Other than that the decor and furniture in the rooms we were alocated were a bit jaded round the edges and looked in need of a bit of a make over and the bathrooms had seen better days Aside from that the Reception and Concierge staff were helpful, efficient and polite. On the whole the Hotel served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “once is enough”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel before I checked online for reviews, ha, so I tried to cancel it with the hotel (even speaking to the manager) but not able to as we took up weekend getaway. made the manager promised to give us a good room. Upon arrival however, staff was rude and flippant, told us the only room with queen bed is on the ground floor though we booked a mth in advance. room was big n unexpectedly clean, old and worn-out though.. My partner was a little insecure that someone might break-in coz its on the ground floor and the pool is just outside. Breakfast was great though, I could have the same thing over n over again. Anyway, would not try the hotel again, bad staff, n a matter of luck in getting a good room.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: Tellyman72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in early February. Having been to Singapore a few times, I knew this hotel wasn't centrally located but chose it based on cost. Upon first impressions, the hotel is tired and worn, but was adequate for my purpose, I didn't spend much time there and wasn't expecting a lot from the hotel. Check in was quick and easy, and the bedrooms were clean, as were the bathrooms but the carpet and furniture had seen better days. Breakfast buffet was poor, but the staff were o.k. The Indian restaurant in the hotel was very good, but it isn't actually part of the hotel, so you can't sign anything to your room. The free shuttle bus was a good service, but the last bus back is 10pm, too early for most people. All in all, it served a purpose but it is nothing special. Don't expect too much and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “pethetic”
Reviews.Author: vipinguptaca
Reviews.Content: Useless, pathetic, very- very poor service, air condition was not working in Singapore think about the humidity in Singapore then think about the necessity of AC. we have shift the room thrice in 2 days. there was lizard on our bed when we check in. very un hygienic.

Reviews.Title: “Extemely poor guest services of Hotel Copthrone Orchid”
Reviews.Author: mukeshmangal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in in Copthorne Orchid Hotel on 28 & 29th Dec 2009 and then on 1st Jan 2010. The staff at the Hotel is very arrogent. They in fact misbehave with the guest with no reason. They get irritated if some information is asked. The other details are as under: 1. No information was available in the room with regard to timing & rules of the swimming pool. Towels were not provided at the swimming pool. The swimming pool water was very dirty. More strangely, the inner door lock of the Male Changing room near the swimming pool was not only faulty but having loose sharp metal edges which could hurt anybody. This is a gross negligence on the part of Hotel Management. 2. Although we four person were staying in one room with breakfast for four persons, only two towels, only one soap, two pouches of sugar & two pouches of tea & Coffee were provided in the room. 3. On next day of my first stay i.e. on 29.12.09, no sugar pouch were put in the room (Room No. 2219) after the room clean up. When my son called the House Keeping In-charge, she talked very rough and told that they had already provided at the time of room cleaning but we had consumed the sugar. She could provide extra if we wanted extra. We told that sugar pouches were not provided. Then I noticed that even towels, foot mat towel were not provided, Dustbin was not cleared & room was not cleaned. Only Bed sheets were changed. I again spoke to House Keeping In charge, but she again spoke very rough. Then I had to call the front desk & then only required Items were arranged in the room. 4. No complementary water bottle were provided in the room. 5. When we again checked in on 01.01.2010, the front desk officer was very rude. Her behavior was such that as if she was giving some complementary stay to us. She asked that when we will check out the room next day, I told around 10 AM. Then she told very rudely that if we do not check out the room before 12 in the room, she will charge $ 98 per room. Similarly she asked for the deposit of $ 100 for two room. When I gave $ 100, she again told very rudely that deposit slip should not be lost otherwise I would not get the refund. 6. Power got tripped in Room No. 2218 on 29.12.09 and AC was not working in Room No. 2210 on 01.01.2010. Both the time, it was attended. AC was also not working properly in the Room No. 2218 on 01.01.2010. I recommend never to stay in this Hotel. Mukesh Mangal

Reviews.Title: “Copthorne Orchid Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bel13884
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks rundown from the outside, but upon entering is excellent presentation. The room was about a five minute walk outside from the reception. the room was tiny, the bathroom was tiny, the toilet flush broke, the shower wet the entire bathroom, the view from our room was a sewer below the freeway. Wasn't an ideal situation but suited us as we were only stopping over for a short time and only spent the nights in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Aged Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKetit
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the week before x'mas. Checking in took quite awhile. The room I got was large. Toilet did not work too well. Carpeting looks like it has been used for the last 20 years or more. In general the hotel furnishing and facilities seems to be in urgent need of renovation. Support service was prompt eg. when requesting for extra pillows, towels etc. Typically went down for breakfast around 8am and found the breakfast cafe to be extremely packed. Food was OK but had to wait awhile to get a seat and table. Shuttle bus ran to town on an hourly basis. Taxi was easy to get - this is Singapore after all. If your main purpose is to visit the Botanic Garden this is the place to stay. M Ketit Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “a very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: vistaworld
Reviews.Content: Copthorne Orchid Hotel is a very charming hotel, extremely comfortable and beautifully designed. I felt very caressed and secured while staying there. The rooms were absolutely fantastic and had everything we needed really including internet connection. We booked the rooms through Last minute travel web site for a very good price, considering the hotel's class and we were so happy we found it as we didn't know it before. We'll certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: krishnabangalore
Reviews.Content: situated near orchid garden,little far from indian restaurants,closer to orchard road.Rooms good and clean,staff courteous,travel desk added advantage.

Reviews.Title: “3 star delux”
Reviews.Author: VirendraPethad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights and we found it to be good. The rooms & bathrooms were really big, spacious and clean. The lobby, building, pool and breakfast area was not too bad either. Its a bit far from the main city, boat quay & clark quay. The breakfast was really really good having lots of varities for vegetarians right from fruits, noodles, rice, breads, curry etc etc. Overall a good 3 star delux hotel with nice arrangments and all basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinBrighton
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous at staying at the hotel after reading several reviews but did ask for a refurbished room and ended up being upgrade to a suite. The room was excellent and no complaints. Service as fine. The breakfast I would suggest if you wake up early to go early, I did this the first day as I was adjusting to the time difference from the UK and there was plenty of space, even tried the peanut porridge which surprisingly was delicious. However, if you arrive after 8am prepare to be busy. One tip is to just go outside to the enclosed fish pond area and have it there. The shuttle I used only once as I was attending a workshop at a nearby university and it takes you directly to a street close by Orchard Road. It would have been nice if they had a few more seats in the reception and the bars at night do Karoke and another one does Chinese singing which was different. All in all the hotel was fine if a little bit off the beaten track but since Singapore is not that big its not that much of a barrier especially as taxis are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “just ok, pictures on website are misleading”
Reviews.Author: third_culture_family
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel, we stayed for 4 nights and 5 days. We supposedly got a room in the "newer" wing of the hotel, which is not the same wing as where the reception desk is. The room was spacious, we had a large king size bed and a single bed. We still had room to walk around and we also had a balcony which overlooked the quiet side street. The bed was comfortable but the room itself looked "tired" which alot of other travellers said. There was mold/damp on the ceiling, but then our room was not in the air-conditioned hallway, but rather the door led out to the open corridor. We actually had to change rooms because the lock on our first room wasn't working properly and the hotel was very accommodating and changed our room efficiently. I already knew that this hotel was not within walking distance of the city, but we used the free shuttle quite often to get to town. Since taxis were cheap, I didn't mind paying for a taxi for the 3 of us to get back to the hotel after dinner. The bellhop was very helpful and friendly. He knew exactly how much it would cost to take a taxi to different sightseeing locations! The front desk staff was friendly and didn't mind when I had to extend checkout twice. Luckily, we have a friend who knew exactly where our hotel was and taught us how to take the local bus into town, which is quite convenient since the bus stop is right outside of the hotel. Breakfast was a buffet everyday. Very basic. Toast, eggs, danish, fruit (watermelon, canned peach, melon, etc...), sausage, chicken congee, coffee, tea, etc...very, very basic. We ate out 2 mornings.

Reviews.Title: “There are two types of rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CSherpa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Copthorne King before and made a mistake when booking this. When I asked how much it would cost to move hotels (because the first room was terrible), I was told that they could not do that but gave up a better room. The second room was literally twice to three times the size of the first one with decent furniture, . The first was minute, dirty and smelt as other reviewers have said. If you get the big room, the value is good. If the small , smelly room, it is terrible. It is clear from the reviews (some with spacious rooms) that people are describing two different things. It is as though there are two hotels. Even the corridors are quite different in the good part.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your time with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego_RO
Reviews.Content: The photos and descriptions are misleading about this hotel. First, it is in a poor location, far from sights one will want to see while in Singapore. Yes, there is a shuttle service but if you prefer to walk or be on your own schedule, this is not the place. Secondly, the room we stayed in were poor quality at best. If you see the lobby, you would expect the room to be somewhat close to its aesthetic level, that is not the case here. Old and outdated furniture and ammenities, moldy walls and ceilings and general lack of upkeep expected from a typical hotel. I tried to switch rooms upon seeing it, but was told none were available (who knows if this was true or not, see next point). Third, the front desk staff were not accomodating or friendly. Definitely do not have the attitude of those that would staff a tourist/business hotel. They were somewhat aloof and did not seem interested in doing anything more than check you in or out, as they conversed amongst each other while guests waited to be checked in. We checked into 2 rooms with another couple on this trip and they mixed up the members of each room on record, we asked them to correct it then and there, yet upon check out the names were still incorrect, therefore creating confusion on the incidental chargers charged to each room and on the refund of the deposit. The only positive would be the bell hop and tour desk personel. They were friendly and accomodating, in an otherwise miserable hotel. I was there as part of a package tour booked by a friend, and this was the hotel selected, otherwise, I would never have stayed here (note that on the second leg of the tour, the hotel choice was excellent). You can find many alternate options to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: WorldRoamer59
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stop on our RTW trip. I knew before I booked this hotel that it was not central but that a shuttle bus was provided to the nearest metro station. I booked this hotel because it came up on a special offer - we paid 88 SGD per night inc breakfast plus tax - very cheap for a decent hotel in Singapore. The shuttle was regular but for the sake of waiting we would usually jump on a bus - the stop is about 200 yds from the hotel - and get to Little India station then continue on from there. Getting back by public transport was not so easy as the hotel is on a main road seperated by barriers so we used taxis which were cheap enough - from Clarke's Key about 8 SGD. The staff were very friendly and helpful at the reception and they upgraded our room as we checked in. We were in the 2nd wing in the hotel - the room was spotless, spacious and we did not hear any outside traffic. We did not have breakfast so cannot comment on that as we were only there 2 nights and had an early start to the airport - we had to leave at 4;45 am and when I asked reception the night before to order me a cab for that time, they helpfully told me that to do so would cost me SGD 7 but it was not necessary as there is always a cab outside. They were true to their word. All in all, it is a bit out of the way but if you want to save your money for shopping rather than paying maybe 2x as much to be central in a decent hotel - I would say give this hotel a go. Buy an EZ travel card and use the bus or hotel shuttle then you should only need to use a taxi once a day to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel in great need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: jacko919
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very poor location. The hotel itself is outdated and smelly. The rooms are awful with mouldy bathrooms and stained carpets. The bar downstairs is laughable; dingy and full of middle aged drunken Japanese men singing terrible songs badly. As you can expect in Singapore, a half pint mug of tiger beer cost £7, but that's city wide. Don't come here if you can help it.

Reviews.Title: “needed an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: ozzypete
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights,had buffet breakfast first morning there,it was rubbish, so ate out the rest of the week.really liked singapore,but not the copthorne orchid, rooms were a bit run down,and air con not good in the rooms,but very good in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “So many better places in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Maccyoz
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed here was because we were offered a really good stopover deal that included breakfast with the orangutans at singapore zoo. I new the location was going to be inconvenient and the reviews on tripadvisor concerned me. There really is no reason to stay here as there are so many better places to be in Singapore. The location is terrible and you have to rely on their shuttle bus to get away from the place or pay for a taxi. While the foyer is grand as soon as you exit the lifts you discover that the place is shabby and in desperate need of renovation - and it smells bad!! The rooms are a good size and the beds are OK but the carpet was sticky and the bathroom is mouldy. We couldn't wait to get out of the place!

Reviews.Title: “copthrone orchid singapore”
Reviews.Author: alpenrock
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. Go to breakfast buffet at beetween 9.30 to 10.30 nobody bother checking your room. even if they ask your room number just tell the next room number. buffet breakfast was superb. internet access is so lousy and damm expensive. they ask 11.50 for an hour or 39 dollars for a day. that is very bad. just give some$20 to the recepcionist she will give you a best room in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “bargain price”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: although not up to its former glory the Orchid Inn is a bargain price nowadays - booked through expedia.co.nz at NZ100 a night including full breakfast for two. The rooms are quite spacious and reasonably furnished. Courtesy Bus to shopping, MRT is a good 20 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “$4 for tea/coffee supplies replenishment!”
Reviews.Author: live_to_travel21
Reviews.Content: Copthorne Orchid is a basic hotel with tired looking furniture. What totally caught me off-guard was when I was told that I would be charged $4 for a replenishment of tea/coffee supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place - far from the hustle of orchid road”
Reviews.Author: indian_familyman
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for a four day trip with my wife and son- The idea was to enjoy our holidays. The hotel pickup service was courteous and nice - and yes in time as well. The hotel was good - new or may be refurbished- and yes, pretty empty too. The rooms were spacious and clean - although the choice of TV channels were a pain. The resturants were not that great. The morning breakfast was strictly okay - with no changes in menu for all the days we spent there. We tried the room service once and then decided to eat out for the entire stay. The sorest point for my kid and wife was the oblivion - the hotel was far away from Orchid road and other attractions of the city - they had thankfully a courttsey bus service every two hours taking you to the Orchid road and back - but then it was too much of clock work - and the only other alternative to reach the hotel was taxi. The hotel staff was not very warm - and that was a big drawback. There were very few smiles shared across. So all in all - if you have family with you and holidays in your mind = avoid this hotel - any other place with better connectivity will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: laxmilobo
Reviews.Content: Not well located, just average for a Singapore Hotel. The noise of the expressway was also very disturbing. There are NO easy connections on public transport from here... The room was not well maintained, only it was a good sized room tats all.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Business, not pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: nush31
Reviews.Content: First of all, when we arrived - inspite of reservations, we had to wait for more than an hour, since the ladies at the front office were not in sync with their systems and eventually advised us to apply for bookings all over again... at a much higher rate! The rooms were small but functional and thankfully hygenic! The food is regular; the facilities better suited for business travellers... not honeymooners! Thankfully, the bus stop was close by...else there is very little to do around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice long drive from the Airport!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NatashaLall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copthorne during a transit to India in May.It was a pleasant stay. Their buffet lunch at one of their restaurants was yummm. They have regular transit coaches to the Orchard Road-DFS Galleria, Little India for the guests. They also have a travel desk. The rooms were clean and spacious.Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: limerickonline
Reviews.Content: On our recent stay we found this hotel to be an excellent choice for a short day in Singapore. Rooms are priced much cheaper than neighbouring hotels. The hotel provides a free shuttle service from the hotel to the main Orchard Road. You can connect from there to all major parts of town. A taxi from the Changi Airport was around $35 single and journey time was approximately 25 minutes. Cheaper options were available, including excellent bus links to and from the city. Rooms are clean and spacious with all the ammenties you would expect from the Copthorne. Although modern the hotel still holds an asian vibe which is brilliant. Inlcuded in most hotel rates the hotel offers Buffet Breakfast. This was more than adequate with American style, as well as asian options available. I would recocmmend this hotel to family and friends. Although the city is a bus ride away, prices of rooms here are much more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - nothing outstanding about this place”
Reviews.Author: traveller076078
Reviews.Content: We had planned the holiday to Singapore on a very short notice, so did not get the time to really research the city for hotels. Went to the travel agent and told him our budget and he booked us this place for us. Now, after having been there, for the price (around SD220), we could have got a better place. On the first impression, the hotel looked well maintained, but moving towards the rooms, the hotel did not have a new look about it. (not complaining but stating the feel) The rooms were pretty nice with clean bed sheets. I had a nice balcony attached to the room. The cable TV did not have many english channels. The bathroom was clean with hot/cold water. To go to orchid street/little India, there is a shuttle at regular interval, which I found to be very convenient, considering that the hotel is situated at a location where there is nothing in the walking distance. For breakfast, go a little early, as it gets really crowded at the end time due to late risers. Breakfast was 100% repetitive, with the same stuff served every day. This surely can be improved. I did not have any meals at the hotel as it was very expensive. So we would have our lunch/dinner at the Orchid street or Little India. People at the reception area were OK. (just friendly enough to give you no chance to complain) The internet was quite expensive. The hotel claimed that they had wi-fi but there was no signal in my room. I would not mind coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claire3
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or cash here. The reception area is misleading as it is a large bright area, which you would expect with the Copthorne Hotel Chain. Once you come out of the lift it goes drastically downhill. The smell of damp in the corridors and the scuff marks on the doors, was awful. Our room was even worse, the bedlinen was badly marked, the window hadn't been cleaned for some time (years by the look of them) but the worse by far was the bathroom. First thing we saw was a large crack in the sink then black mould on the tiles the place was just filthy. Electricity sockets had huge cracks going through them. We only stayed in the hotel less than an hour before moving to the Copthorne which was a very nice hotel. At no time did the staff ask we were leaving, they were totally uninterested.

Reviews.Title: “only for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: sharat
Reviews.Content: I actually booked it through hotels.com, where the prices were really cheap. but I didn't wait for the confirmation and landed up there, so ended up paying hefty amount. It's purely for the business traveller and it's really far from where the real action lies. The malls are far...the bus stop is close by but you've to wait a lot for the bus. Nothing else to say, it's merely average.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is looking good and good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: basheer26
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks realy great and thier serivce also is very good and i would realy recommend this for the family and even for other categories.. We joyed the great time and it was a family trip and the restaurant looks great thier services too

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Naveen37
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went to singapore to spend some good quality time, as soon we were out from Singapore Airport the View was fantastic and the weather was pritty good but the moment we steped into our Hotel all our tireness was gone. The welcome and the hospitality shown by the staff was excellent, It actually ment " Athiti devo Bhava". Food, decore and staff was very good, they actually made you comfertable as if you are at your home. If by any chance I happped to go again I will preffer the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK IF YOU ARE A FAMILY OR WOMAN! THE BROCHURE IS MIS-LEADING”
Reviews.Author: clair48
Reviews.Content: On first impressions, it looks nice, the lobby is presentable. Beyond that the hotel is out of date. The rooms are dated with flaking paint and smell musky and the swimming pool looks dirty again very run down. I booked for the swimming pool and spa and I am sadly disappointed. I can't bring myself to put a toe in the pool. It advertised a health spa - turns out this is male only! Read what you will into that as I am female and there is no health spa and massage for me. The hotel is not near the Orchard Rd and is far from any major shopping. the hotel has an OK brasserie and business services. Do not book for a long trip or holiday with a family! you will be dis-appointed. This hotel is OK for business men for 1 night who can go to the health spa

Reviews.Title: “not good enough for a singapore recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: springqueen
Reviews.Content: stayed overnight on way to Bali. The hotel is way away from anything else and the shuttle is not frequent enough to work well. we had to ask for an additional pillow, as they only provided one for each bed and one extra. and there was dirt and bits of toilet paper on the floor of the bathroom. plus NO clock and limited TV stations. plus creamer instead of milk. although am not sure if creamer is the usual in Asian hotels, as we found same problem in our Bali hotels. staff on the whole were helpful when they could understand us, and they let us use the internet for free to find something needed to buy for medical reasons. the breakfast wasnt bad , and had a lot of variety, and the outlook of the restaurant is kinda nice. however, have to agree, even the lobby stank of mould. i know the tropics have this problem but you neeed to make sure the rooms are well ventilated. there is no view at all in any of the rooms and our room was so far away from the elevator along corridors with badly worn carpet. anyone with a slight allergy would be sick staying in this hotel especially for longer than one night. we were actually suffereing with sinus problems from about two hours after we arrived and we spent as little time as possible there because of the smell. I will pay and stay somewhere else, closer to either Orchard Rd or at the airport if only one night. you can make up for some of additional cost with less need to use taxis to get into town. Singapore has excellent public transport if you are staying near it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good name around city”
Reviews.Author: PranayNigotiya
Reviews.Content: hotel has a good name but the its a decent hotel with decent rooms..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people but hotel needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Sweett3a
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Singapore alone and stayed a couple of days at Copthorne Orchid. The lobby was inviting, frontdesk help was friendly but when I walked into my room I was utterly dissappointed. The smell was bad, it was not the cleanest and I just could not get comfortable. The service was great and the food was good also but I really expected more for my US dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, clean rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sunnyscot86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days and I really enjoyed staying at the hotel. Rooms are nice and comfortable and well air conditioned. Staff were very helpful and friendly, as are most Singaporeans. Free shuttle bus into orchid road runs regularly and you are given a timetable for it upon arrival. The breakfast was fine, plenty of cereals toast etc, the usual stuff, nice and attentive staff. I can't understand the negative reviews here as we had absolutely no problems, our flight home was later in the evening and check out is at 11, we were given a room for 30 mins to shower before our taxi to the airport; we did go over the 30 mnins quite a bit but no one bothered us or even mentioned it which is nice. Singapore is nice for a short stopover, however my only gripe with this hotel is its location is a bit far though taxis are pretty cheap, I would possibly consider a closer hotel although this one is extremely nice for the price, you'd have to weigh it up as closer hotels are slightly dearer.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected, wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: stevehn787
Reviews.Content: Was dirty mould in bathroom, beds were hard, and was too far out of the city, they did have a courtesty shuttle bus at times during the day, but coming home there was only one trip late at night, and if this was full they wouldnt come back for anyone. on the plus side, breakfast was great, service was ok, but rooms were very average and bathroom dirty

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Lonneke29
Reviews.Content: Our most disapointing stop over experience ever! Unfriendly staff, chaos at reception. The room wasn't ready until in the afternoon (we only stayed for one night!). We were offered a room for 30 minutes for a quick shower, but this room wasn't cleaned, used towells and an awfull smell. The room we ended up staying in was, like the rest of the hotel, totally out of date. The location is away from the major attractions in Singapore, the hotel offers a free shutlle service but not very frequent. Don't go here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JammyIndia
Reviews.Content: It's a great big hotel! Big spacious rooms, clean bathrooms, air-conditioned with sumptious breakfast - hash browns, croissants, cereals, made to order eggs, fresh juices, fruits, etc. The staff is helpful too. Accomodating ahead of check-in if room is available. We especially loved the clean white bed linen. A little away from the centre, but singapore is a small country!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Passepartout56
Reviews.Content: This is easily the worst hotel I have stayed in for many years. From the outside I soon realised that all was not well with a general tired look about the place and lots of flaking paint...never a good sign in my opinion. I found the receptionist to be quite surly and far from welcoming. (I was actually staying in the hotel for one night as a stopover due to changes in airline schedule). I got the distinct impression that the hotel gets a large number of stop over guests and, as a result, possibly feels it doesn't have to try too hard. My room was on the top floor and had most certainly seen better days. The net curtains were decidedly grubby and the bed sheet stained in one of the two beds in the room. The literature left by the hotel itself in the room was also out of date (advertising Christmas meals) as was the television schedule but the television reception was very poor anyhow. The only saving grace in my opinion was the restaurant where I had a delicious dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yogi_D
Reviews.Content: I had a stay at this hotel in Nov08 for 3 days. The exterior of hotel is as good as interior.Nice spacious rooms, cool view from room terrace, good food, clean pillows & bedsheets. TV is also nice, but don't have much English channels . It is slightly costlier, but worth staying . Free shuttle service to Mustafa, Mini India, Botanical Garden is added advantage . What I didn't like is the hotel is far away from civilization. Nearest shop is also not at walkable distance. Taxis are not that cheap. Overall, it's great hotel .

Reviews.Title: “below par”
Reviews.Author: JETLAG01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to rate as the worst I have stayed in. If cleanliness, and value are your measurables then don't stay here. From cigarette burns in the carpets and furniture to uncomfortable beds and grubby passages this rates as a 1 star. I arrived pretty late and walked into reception area with undesirable people lazing around the shabby couches smoking. The only good thing about this hotel is they offer a free shuttle service to the city as it is too far to walk even though its name would suggest that it is in the shopping area of Orchid st. A definite NO - be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and very average”
Reviews.Author: cassandra83
Reviews.Content: First time stay in Singapore , booked the Copthorne because of its location near the botanic gardens and the fact it wasn't to expensive without being super small. We booked though an Internet agent one double room and one twin room. Arrived to be given two twin rooms, and we were unable to be moved. Apparently all the double rooms were booked. The staff were unapologetic trying to say that all standard rooms were twins (this is definitely not the case). Unfortunately our stay went from bad to worse. The hallway to the room was open to weather, with the ground being mouldy, and the rooms were very dated. The restaurant was over priced, and the Internet $11/30mins. The hotels only saving grace was there free shuttle bus, and reasonable sized rooms. In the end when we thought we were away from it all, three days later we were double charged on our credit card from the hotel. This took numerous international calls to sort out. I don't think I could recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Rivoli08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as a stop over. The hotel lobby has been updated but the rest of the hotel is tired. The furnishings throughout the hotel were badly stained, including a sofa bed in our room which had a urine stain that you could not only clearly see but also smell! The hotel is also not really located within walking distance of much (particularly given the very humid weather that Singapore has), although cab fares are so reasonable this is perhaps not an issue for everyone. Our main reason for choosing this hotel was that it was near the Botanical Gardens which we wanted to visit. The hotel said they offered a free shuttle but we discovered that the free shuttle only went twice a day (once in the morning and then at 6.30pm at night) and there was no return pick-up. Fairly crap idea of a shuttle really. The shuttle bus to the Orchard Rd however was much more frequent. We ate at the restaurant buffet one night at it was a reasonable option compared to the ordering off the menu (about AUS $40/head). Overall thought it was overpriced for what it was. Not having stayed elsewhere in Singapore recently though it may really just be a case of you get what you pay for, although I'm still sure you could do better than here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but you need to take taxi to go anywere”
Reviews.Author: rosied20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the staff are helpful. The room was nice enough it was your average 3.5 star hotel. The only downfall of this hotel was that there is nothing around the hotel - however a free shuttle service is availabe to and from Orchad road (famous shopping street) Otherwise you need to use taxi to get anywere - nothing nearby by foot. I would not stay there again - probably would prefer something more on central side near MRT. Did not eat in the hotel so could not comment on the food. If you are looking to do any tours there are also two tour desks available - i do recommend the night safari.

Reviews.Title: “Fine...nice busy hotel but very dated”
Reviews.Author: icyoubaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very busy hotel with a nice modern lobby area. The rest of the hotel however is a little dated and although their is a free shuttle bus into the city, there is nothing else to do in the area of the hotel. The breakfast buffet is good. I was upgraded to a more deluxe room which was fine, but I have stayed in much better Copthorne hotels! Aside from that, I would have no reason not to go back.

Reviews.Title: “1 Day Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: cylia82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel out of convenience as the coach I took from Kuala Lumpur stopped right there at the hotel lobby. The location of the hotel is near Orchard Road - the famous shopping area of Singapore but only accessible by taxi, not by foot or MRT. The room condition was a bit old. I couldn't complain much as I only spent a night there.

Reviews.Title: “Experience at Copthorne Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rupetto
Reviews.Content: My collegue living in Singapore booked for me this hotel. The room doesn't look brand new, the bathroom need some upgrades, anyway it's clean. food is ok, they have a nice buffet. Location: very far from shopping center; it's ok for business people with contacts in this area, but not for tourist.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but ridiculously overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: tanvimadkaiker
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and well lit. Sanitized and hygenic bathrooms (with the slight defect of a faulty flush) Complimentary breakfast was very good and ambience and sevice was excellent. But for a 3 star hotel, the price was exorbitant! We paid 150 USD per night for only a decent hotel! There was a marriott promotion that was offering a weekend stay at 118 S$!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving Price on Website and Wal-in”
Reviews.Author: tanwinson
Reviews.Content: Saw a few ads in the website stating the rate of S$151-190++. I thought that i was be able to just walk-in or call in to confirm my reservations. When i called them, they told me that the price for a single room cost me S$325++. When i question them about the rates that i saw on the websites, the receptionist told me that i have to book it in the website and it is subject to approval. Looks like it this hotel's regulations are more like a bank. Taking a loan and waiting for approval. The receptionist is not courteous at all. No greetings of even a Good evening when she picked up the phone. Seriously, i would not recommend anyone to even stay in those hotel at all. and to anyone out there, i know hotels in Singapore are very expensive, but for this is too deceiving. I feel that i've just been scammed.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MONGLALA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located away from the popular Orchard shopping district. Many tourists flock to Orchard and it is the most popular area of Singapore for tourists. Orchard Road also has great connections to the MTR making everywhere else in Singapore only a short train journey away. Copthorne is not located near a MTR station. Next door to the Raffels Town Club (not the Raffels Hotel), the hotel is quite basic. Rooms are comfortable, but modest. Old television sets are common as is small amounts of mould in the bathroom. Staff are quite friendly. Breakfast is only worth it if you get it for free, but don't purchase it on top, its pretty average. Porters don't carry your luggage up for you, you do this yourself. If you are in Singapore for tourism, this place is good as it is cheap. Don't worry too much about the fact that the hotel is located outside the most popular tourist areas, taxis are plenty and very cheap by Western standards. Also, as Singapore is so close, the taxi journey is quite short. Expect to pay $4-6 to the Marriott on Orchard. Walking time to the Marriott is 25 minutes. All in all, not bad, not great.

Reviews.Title: “no longer the mas bus connection”
Reviews.Author: scotaussie
Reviews.Content: By Singapore standards this is a remote hotel well away from the city centre and more importantly the metro system. They run a free bus shuttle to the city, fine for shopping but pain if you only want to go out to eat. Only advantage is it is outside the congestion charge area so taxi from the aiport was just S$20. However we stayed here for one night as we understood it was the connection for the MAS bus to Senai Airport. THIS IS NO LONGER THE CASE. We asked at reception and they just said it was now cancelled and gave no assistance on alternative transport. You actually get a taxi from a special stand in the city centre to Johor Baru and then they arrange a second taxi to Senai. S$60. Can see no other reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary at best”
Reviews.Author: lellel
Reviews.Content: OK, so my review is pretty late, but I am only using this site as I prepare for my next holiday. It has been such a blessing that I thought it best to share my experiences for the best of others. I arrived in at the hotel at 4am on a Saturday morning after a bus trip from KL. Tiired after flying into KL from Tokyo, I was desperate for sleep. I found the hotel staff very harsh and unsympothetic to my cause as my room wasn't available. The only option was an upgrade, which I would have to pay for. I tried to get some kind of leniancy (forgive spelling) from the receptionist, but without luck. Even a smile might have helped, but found them coming across as unhappy people, unwilling to bend in any way to be helpful, or at least understanding to my situation. I took the upgrade. The room was spacious compared to the ones I had stayed in before, though basic in furnishings. As a regular 2 or 3 star traveller, I was happy with that, but not the bathroom, which had a puddle of water around the toilet and some mould around the shower. The batheroom really needed some work. The location wasn't that great either. I guess maybe my travel agent had some deal with that hotel, as I expected it to be reasonably close to the shopping areas. Instead though, it was a 5 - 10 minute taxi ride to Orchis road shops. I am sure one can do better than this out of the way hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't pay to stay here ....”
Reviews.Author: majorstu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight, courtesy of an airline, when our connecting flight was cancelled. Although I didn't pay I wasn't particularly impressed. The rooms are large and spacious, but the decor is old and tired. Our room had a balcony overlooking the major dual carriage way that runs along outside the hotel.
